titles.en: Chapter 56 – The charity upon the one whom one does not recognise

titles.ar: بَابُ الصَّدَقَةِ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْبَوَادِي وَ أَهْلِ السَّوَادِ
titles.en: Chapter 57 – The charity upon the people of the valleys and the people of the wilderness
Chapter 55 – The ones whose expenses are necessitated

titles.ar: بَابُ الصَّدَقَةِ عَلَى مَنْ لَا تَعْرِفُهُ
titles.en: Chapter 56 – The charity upon the one whom one does not recognise

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/140)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ سَدِيرٍ الصَّيْرَفِيِّ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أُطْعِمُ سَائِلًا لَا أَعْرِفُهُ مُسْلِماً فَقَالَ نَعَمْ أَعْطِ مَنْ لَا تَعْرِفُهُ بِوَلَايَةٍ وَ لَا عَدَاوَةٍ لِلْحَقِّ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يَقُولُ وَ قُولُوا لِلنَّاسِ حُسْناً وَ لَا تُطْعِمْ مَنْ نَصَبَ لِشَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ الْحَقِّ أَوْ دَعَا إِلَى شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنَ الْبَاطِلِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz, from Sadeyr Al Sayrafi who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullahasws, ‘Shall I feed a beggar whom I do not recognise as being a Muslim?’ So heasws said: ‘Yes, you can give to the one who is neither recognised with the Wilayah nor enmity towards the Truth. Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic is Saying [2:83] and you shall speak to the people good words, and do not give to the one who establishes hostility to something from the Truth, or calls towards something from the falsehood’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from Sadir al-Sayrafiy who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘I know someone is asking for help, but I do not know if he is a Muslim or not.’ The Imam said, ‘You can give charity to one whom you do not know is a friend or enemy of the truth. Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Glorious, has said, “Say good words to people.” [2:83] Do not give charity to those who are hostile to the truth or call people to something of falsehood.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/140)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْفَضْلِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ السَّائِلِ يَسْأَلُ وَ لَا يُدْرَى مَا هُوَ قَالَ

text: أَعْطِ مَنْ وَقَعَتْ لَهُ الرَّحْمَةُ فِي قَلْبِكَ وَ قَالَ أَعْطِ دُونَ الدِّرْهَمِ قُلْتُ أَكْثَرُ مَا يُعْطَى قَالَ أَرْبَعَةُ دَوَانِيقَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Fazl Al Nowfaly, from his father,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having been asked about the beggar who asks and it is not known what he is?’ Heasws said: ‘Give to the one for whom the mercy occurs in your heart’. And heasws said: ‘Give less than one Dirham’. I said, ‘What is the most one can give?’ Heasws said: ‘Four Dawaneeqs (a unit of measurement)’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Fadl al-Nawfaliy from his father who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was asked about giving charity to an unidentified person. He replied, ‘You can give charity to one for whom you feel sympathy in your heart.’ He said, ‘Give him less than a dirham.’ I asked, ‘What is the maximum I can give?’ He replied, ‘It is four Dawaniq (a certain measurement of things).”’
